pages.text: The Crystalline Prism has a front that can only be placed on the horizontal plane, and is another version of the Beam Splitter. Instead of making two beams of identical colors, it takes a beam in the back, top, and/or bottom and outputs up to three beams made from the input beam.

A pure $(energy)energy$() beam from the left of the front, a pure $(potential)potential$() beam from the front, and a pure $(stability)stability$() beam from the right of the front. Any void in the original beam is lost. Crystalline Prisms are expensive, so use them sparingly.
